topic.title: Quantum penguin sees cosmic frog?
topic.body:
Bright flash of infrared light coming from the black hole at the center of the galaxy observed by the Keck II telescope in Hawaii.  Shadilay!

https://twitter.com/quantumpenguin/status/1160368687590727680

1565330250_18h7dSc5vXQNRA1sjyUmX7zaUTsFA.body:
> [saythenword](#comment_4_1PK8e7ccdA28Xi8mDbmZd6SLQSgZaxDAzg): I can actually see less posts on 08chan tonight, than I could last night on the same install for some reason. [...]

I'm beginning to think that BO made some error in response to the spamming.  I have two directories on a removable drive.  The first one will bring up the complete 08chan, and update.  However, no peers will take my posts.  The second one was a fresh install, after the implementation of ZeroIDs.  That's the one which is now stuck updating like you and others have noted.

> [aim64c](#comment_9_17GmcqqqJdfEM4DkRsqvvprifPVwYx575h): Even before the update, mine would hang at like 20k files left to download - but at least it was keeping up with activity on the site.It could be a problem with the update, but it could also be a combined problem in zeronet, especially if seeding has become centralized and what another noted down below is indeed the case, and we have a situation where it's a needle in a haystack in terms of finding someone who is actually seeding the site.  I also saw connected peers take a nosedive.  I was up over 8k before the update, then I got hammered right back down to 100 and it's risen back up to around 1000, now.  It could be that we're seeing an artifact of a site change propagating across a network of thousands as opposed to dozens/hundreds.  Since it's not a central server pushing the updates to everyone, everyone needs to check with everyone else to see if they are the most up to date file(s).  So long as everyone you poll for an update has the old file, you will think you're up to date - until the authoritative change takes place.

I thought that was the case at first too, propagation issues.  However I can load the whole package with my first instantiation, and see new post activity there.  It's only the genericID disabled version that's hanging now.

> [aim64c](#comment_10_17GmcqqqJdfEM4DkRsqvvprifPVwYx575h): kek... we've got a fork in the zite.  Or ... something.  So, when they get the propagated site code dished out to them, they'll get squelched?  Alas, even on ZeroNet, auto-update should be turned off.  The more things change, the more they stay the same.

Never was enamored with the forking idea, and BO has not been fully transparent with the reasoning.  At the very least could have documented the changes and / or additions.  That's legitimately got anons almonds activated, as it would be expected from a glow nigger.  I'm not lurking two more years, so I would expect Acidman to check this thread and at minimum keep the communication flowing.

> [aim64c](#comment_11_17GmcqqqJdfEM4DkRsqvvprifPVwYx575h): I think people are on edge, and it's understandable.  I also think that this is exactly what you would see in the instance where someone was a little too trusting of technology and/or inexperienced in a development role.By a fork, though - I meant just in terms of site revision.I think AcidMan is genuine in that he created the board long ago during the gamer gate fiasco, mainly thinking of it as a place where he and his friends could meet if things went south.  ZeroNet was a means to an end for him in terms of it just got the job done, and the name popularity of 8chan served to keep it rather popular on ZN, which was, itself, virtually unknown or only commented on. [...]

I also think Acidman is genuine, just a bit overwhelmed at this stage.  I'm not poking him, other than the documentation aspect.  Maybe as you allude, he doesn't have the resources.  Did say he was going to work on it this weekend, so you're right that slack should be given.  I'll leave this broken instantiation seeding all overnight, whatever that might do while stuck on 2742.

> [bustooni](#comment_2_13v3xsu1y5pTbf3ZydiKYCZUhCFqdAs2NY): try clicking on "Check files" on the right hand side of 08chan's listing in the Sites section of your ZeroHello sidebar.  Seems to have forced an update for me - 'updating' number refreshed, reduced greatly and went down to 0 over a couple of mins.

Test posting is only showing "Processing post... Please wait."  It does appear functioning for some anons though.  Catalog seems way to minimal with seven threads and a total of 36 replies.  That would be over the past 20+ hours now.  Suppose there are only a fraction of legitimate peers, out of a large number induced during the spam attack?  If I can only connect with five at a time, how can I tell with each attempt if these are changing?

> [ayylmaolol](#comment_4_1E5GcuKhRw6sujdX3XKosJ54HFJ4pMtr14): It worked fine for me in the past day.If nothing works for you, just consider starting with a fresh zeronet.

Have you tried your own advice?  I did this yesterday, and have two different directories on a removable drive.  One loads 08chan after BO implemented ZeroIDs but won't let me post.  The other is the fresh ZeroNet and that's the one currently stuck.  Not that I can post in either one, atm.

> [autist](#comment_3_1PxkuTN6oZst8Q7inUZb6xqGJrtkHTGkDq): exact same situation here

Also tried your fix, but ZeroID is spazzing out too.
Error while during request: Forbidden
Please try again later.

I'm tinkering with the users.json file now.  If I can get anything to upload on any 08chan board, I'll post here.

I have two zeroid.bit to work with.  Either one is selectable for ZeroTalk, but I'll stick with "undisclosed" for this discussion.  Either one partially works with 08chan, no perceivable difference.  Both get stuck updating files, although slightly different file counts.  Deleting the board from the left side bar and reloading from 127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/ had no effect on the files refusing to update.  It also makes no difference if I modify users.json manually or through the gui.  Creating a new thread or replying get stuck "Processing post... Please wait."  File attachments do get processed, however I only tried images.  It was going a bit further yesterday, before hitting an endless while loop "Content published to 0/5 peers".  Since 0chan works for me with anonymous certs, I'll just have to be patient and wait for the next board update.

> [autist](#comment_4_1PxkuTN6oZst8Q7inUZb6xqGJrtkHTGkDq): 0chan has a bunch of cp on it be careful

I needed to retest posting with anonymous cert.  I'm not using an interface with no catalog.  It was deleted an hour ago.  I'm not seeding, and checked for file residue.  They won't be sending any v& this way due to 0chan.

I'm in again, and all I did was have a nice medium rare rib eye steak.  When I got done eating, so was the file update.  However this got unstuck, it was the problem.  I left my users.json with my original ZeroID tied to 08chan.  Only one remaining problem; not enough peers.  The technical issue went away, perhaps due to BO fixing.  All threads that weren't bumped from the attack are back, and post count is normal at 6507 now.

> [08admin](#comment_2_1KSUcqHRcq26pF5vJ2297jrNcAzkNvLtSH): I've been tinkering with the site trying to get a fix for all files to show under the new cert.  If it seems to be especially wonky, look for posts my be talking about progress because I might be just fucking with it at the time you're trying to do something. [...]

Doing the lord's work anon.  Now if only I could get more than 0/5 peers with 08chan.  It looks like about 30 posts right now (two are mine), aren't getting seeded.  I mention this because it was the early symptom when you initially locked the zite down.

> [kaffie](#comment_962_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Why would you use 08chan when it's so clearly inferior?

You need to understand that 08chan was implemented as a fall back option during the time of Gamergate.  There's a trust factor involved with respect to the anon doing the development work.  This is of understated importance.  Migrating to milchan may happen, yet we've been here only a few days now.  When I tested one of your milchan boards, my post wasn't anonymous (just an example).  I'm not a fan of forking at all, and the result with 08chan is no longer open source.  However, this concern is mitigated by knowledge regarding credibility of the zite owner.

> [kaffie](#comment_966_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): I didn't make the site, I'm just linking it. This is the announcement post. Pretty sure it's made by the original guy who made millchan.

Okay, I get it - not your site.  I'm not really as concerned with anonymity, so I gave a bad example.  Obviously TOR + VPN or why bother m8.  To answer your question though, "Why do you trust them?", I give benefit of doubt to other National Socialists.  He has already said he's not the end all developer, and neither would I be if I got up to speed.  White people have a faster learning curve though, so I'll ride with my own.  Regarding CP, I'm not afraid of the wild-west frontier.  If I get v& it will be for something much different.

> [kaffie](#comment_967_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): True anonymity, which is what chans try to provide, isn't possible here on zn. Pseudoanonymity is fine though (account post history, but no connection between account and real person). [...]

You got an upvote for understanding.  Give it time, since it's also a matter of where other anons will end up too.  I don't need to be persuaded one way or another really.  If I can shitpost, promote memes in peace, dox, dig and help secure the existence of our people and a future for white children, that's all I'm asking of ZeroNet.

> [domhnall](#comment_1_1NEU47WbD2zt9N1FpD1fmmZzqNr5Ypk1vc): Same here. I deleted the site from ZeroNet in an attempt to get image posting through the Tor Browser working, and now I can't post anything at all, even just a simple "test" text post. Don't know what the fuck happened but here I am, I guess.

> [5464633464343435](#comment_1_1PVeAVH8LnpmqkaAW2RMm2Tx5LFD6wteng): been trying to post on there even while missing all the old posts and it just gets stuck on Processing post... Please wait.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_892_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): the site contains multiple topics that can point you to an explanation on how to fix it. Example topic here [...]

Had the same problem for most of yesterday, until updates got unstuck.  Once you get past this, the next issue is that for some reason it's showing 0/5 peers.  This eventually times out to a failed post.  Is there some way to clear out peers for 08chan, restart, and have new ones connect?  If I'm reading sites.json file correctly, 08chan had 2517 peers when I just tried to test post.  I'd like to flush this and reconnect with live peers, as I suspect many of these 2517 are dysfunctional residue from the spam attack.  So I'll have a look at the link from ssdifnskdjfnsdjk next, but expect it's already something I've tried.

> [08admin](#comment_6_1KSUcqHRcq26pF5vJ2297jrNcAzkNvLtSH): We got it fixed a couple hours ago.  Based partly on the idea from this discussion and help from several users. [...]

Well at least I'm getting a new error "Content signing failed".

> [08admin](#comment_6_1KSUcqHRcq26pF5vJ2297jrNcAzkNvLtSH): We got it fixed a couple hours ago.  Based partly on the idea from this discussion and help from several users. [...]

Only stuck once, looks good now.  Thank you!

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_900_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Try to open the 08chan site menu (move corner button to the left) and scroll down to the IDENTITY ADDRESS field where you can try to change to zeroid and reload page? You made sure the option "This is my site" is not active and you "Check files" of the 08chan on the ZeroHello site (three dots menu next to site name)? may take some time to download the content.

I'm fine now, that was a once off problem.

> [prologic](#comment_8_12fWKDf6FpQhpQua3g1UkA1z6AxHSF1d2p): The lack anonymity is troubling because it literally syncs everything and I don't really appreciate that. I would like for websites to offer options to sync certain parts and completely nuke others... 8ch seems to do that for now, so that's good.

I'd want the board listing's Pin/Unpin function to work like the filter was apparently intended.  In other words, don't pin a board, and nothing there is seeded.  I can understand if that sort of function was disabled by intent, since it would take extra effort to get new boards properly seeded.  Yet as it stands right now, I have to act as [M]oderator for all of it, which won't stop pollution if I seed while asleep.

Crusius manifesto occurred twelve minutes AFTER the El Paso Police Dept. twitter feed announced an active shooter.  That's with Mountain Time converted to Coordinated Universal Time.  I don't keep or want any social media footprint.  The last time I had to use a burner phone for Twitter to get their voice confirmation code. Glow niggers have already got all they need to v& anyone.  They don't need to ask your VPN services who you are.  Hiding behind 6 million proxies or VPNs is just begging to be flagged.  One VPN + TOR works because it's the status quo, and you're not exposing youself to 99.9% of the other fuckers.  If you have to ask, you're probably already on multiple lists.

1565661379_13Gu27WksygoMQzLpktTGzZTHumTN.body: Acidman worked all weekend on getting ZeroID properly implemented to return the boards basic functionality, and add a layer of insulation from spam attacks.  He has a day job, so important fixes such as TOR image posting might not get addressed until his next two days off.  The problem is still there, it's just that some anons are willing to run through another browser.  TOR + VPN with ZeroNet on a removable drive using say FireFox as the interface is about the best anyone has right now.  I haven't seen any workaround that wouldn't involve migration to Millchan Engine, or exposing html canvas in TOR.

1565649984_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsK.body:
> [theecollector](#comment_2_15rMfe5FVSWwMffJvTpBUq9dFiLQPNxkuU): so in stupid person words is zeronet safe or what??

That's a loaded question, so I'll answer within the framework of OPs observation.  Avast has trouble keeping up with false positives, and IDP:Generic is a default position.  OP should try another flavor of ice cream by running a newer and better free anti-virus package like Panda Dome instead.  ZeroNet is frontier, but safer than Texas was in the 1840s.

1565724346_1Hc87xHmLsZyaGTQYnx2UmQPKwE1E.body:
> [bigbadbob](#comment_264_1CLhLYdMKjXtium9yjuRkSnFvPfdoUTXAj): That will do it.   Blocking 14 eyes countries sounds very interesting.  Does that make tor really slow?   Not that it would bother me

I had success when I needed to have a specific TOR exit code repeatable for any circuit.  Applications like Twitter for example, expect new accounts to come from the same IP (at least for awhile).  It's another layer they started using awhile back to mitigate sockpuppet accounts.  There is also an exclude function, although the documentation suggests it isn't failsafe.  I haven't tried this, however the idea of blocking countries is appealing and this should do the job:

"If StrictNodes is set to 0, Tor will still try to avoid nodes in the ExcludeNodes list, but it will err on the side of avoiding unexpected errors. Specifically, StrictNodes 0 tells Tor that it is okay to use an excluded node when it is necessary to perform relay reachability self-tests, connect to a hidden service, provide a hidden service to a client, fulfill a .exit request, upload directory information, or download directory information."

https://tor.stackexchange.com/questions/733/can-i-exit-from-a-specific-country-or-node

1566939301_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsK.body:
> [nickwa](#comment_413_1EFZ3dYDWVpD4kF5H9PF83HjPAehEEKKJj): You can break driver installs from windows updates in the registry.

Windows 10 Registry hack to stop automatic driver updates:

1) Open HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows
2) Create a new key named WindowsUpdate
3) Select WindowsUpdate in the left pane and right-click on a blank spot in the right pane to select a new DWORD (32-bit) Value to be named ExcludeWUDriversInQualityUpdate
4) Now that ExcludeWUDriversInQualityUpdate has been created, double-click on it to change the value data from 0 (allow) to 1 (turn off)

1569269870_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
> [trustedleanings](#comment_41_1MfahbRQx2DvKRccN57nhFZvYmfirQfZeX):  You may be able to mount a legal case in your favor, but if you're fighting the town or city you're unlikely to win.

What styromaniac is probably missing, that in theory allows an owner to say fuck off to all the municipal bullshit, is the original patent for the land.  Chances are, the previous owner of the property didn't have this either.  So at some point in the chain of title, a bank held the patent.  Do you think when China for example buys land in the U.S. that they're paying for anything less than the property with patent?  What happens is that somewhere in the chain of title, a buyer needs to mortgage, and that's when the bank required the patent for collateral.  Then the propery may get subdivided, in which case the ownership also gets spread out, so no individual has complete claim on the original patent.  The solution is not inexpensive, and will require a full title search to begin with.  A surveyor will need to obtain new measurements of your boundaries, and a new plat drawn up.  Then you must have a notarized copy of the original patent, and prove your subdivision with the results of the title search.  Don't even think about suing unless you have more than just the title to the property.  If you live in a city, you may not have anything better than title to a "lot"; subdivision of an original patent.  In this case, the city will be holding the patent, and you won't ever.

3. It appears there was an outbreak of sorts in China, but the Chinese government is quoting very low numbers and only a few dead, while obvious hoaxers on Twitter are posting videos from all times of the year claiming they just happened and saying thousands are dying because there are dead people laying everywhere. However, every major city has that many people laying in the streets daily due to either bike accidents or car accidents or passing out from strokes - Wuhan has a population of 11 million, there would therefore, by statistic, be multiple videos of people laying in the streets for various reasons daily. You'll get that many from gunshots alone in Chicago in one day. So there's plenty of hoax fodder, quite well proven by the fact the hoaxers did not get the time of year right, they just used whatever looked good.

4. BIG PROBLEM - Britain is running with this, and doing quarantines. And if they are taking it that far there's little doubt it is going to be done in the U.S. also.

5. BIGGER PROBLEM: Gates has the vaccine ready to go already.

Here is the end game, as I see it:

There is a strong possibility that this virus, hoax or real, is going to be used for a martial law style crack down in various nations, including the United States. If this happens in the United States, it could be used as a pretext for even heavier crack downs, complete with gun grabs and forced "vaccinations" - For a virus Bill Gates has patents on, PLUS the vaccine for, while he babbled all about how vaccines should be used for population reduction.
